comment: Wonderful bottle with delicious fruity complexity. If this were a little cheaper I would have this on hand all the time. As it is, I enjoy the opprtunties I get to try this when they arise.
This will always hold a special place in my heart! So smooth.
Fantastic drop! Fruity and too easy to drink
Quiet a good drop but I must say I somehow thought the 12 yo was a bit more complex and nicer all round. Would not buy again considering the price difference between the two.
Good but expekted more from it
Almost effervescent nose, with fruit.  Very smooth.  Not as smooth as Midleton.  Sweet after taste.  Looking for caramel, but not finding it.  fruit is grape like.  Very clean on the nose.

At the Rod 'n Reel and decided to order a dram.  As described, honey-amber color with a fruity nose with straw, banana and toasted coconut.  Arrives extremely soft and gentle and then opens nicely to spice and sweetness.  The sweetness of creme brûlée with a pinch of cinnamon and nutmeg. The palate remains soft throughout, never thinning while holding all the the flavors. As the dram finishes, a slight amount of bitterness, oak and spice remain and hang around for quite some time.  Overall, an easy soft and sweet dram that is balanced very well. Not overly complicated and enjoyable. [87/100][Tasted: 8/22/15]
Lingering finish that seems to go on for ages. I might be confusing oil for 'n strong chutney like plum taste. The nose had a fruit like character but I found it difficult to get anything else.
Smooth Pour! I am not a Jameson fan by any means.  My local shop convinced me to pick it up, glad they did!

Nose - Faint Earl Grey tea, lychees, apples, honey, grilled pineapple, lightly smoked/grilled Asian pear.
Taste - Honeyed blend of black and green teas, light tart/bitter apple seed, smooth caramel-like sweetness.
Finish - Lingering light tart/dry tea bitterness, apple/grape juice blend, grape seed tartness/bitterness.
81/100

The only thing keeping this from a 5-star qua the proof; too easy to drink and wish it were a bit more intense.  Easily the most drinkable Irish I own (and thank you Pub32 for introducing me to this).
Kinda worse than regular jameson , had at maddys
Exactly what I expect of a good whiskey.
Nem at drikke, let smag, sød

I haven't tried many irish whiskies but I thought I'd buy a bottle of the 18 for St Patrick's day while I was on holidays.  An extremely easy whisky to drink probably the smoothest whisky I've drank to date. So much sweetness from the nose to the palate even my wife commented on the strong taste of honey & caramel. I enjoyed the 18 & will definitely buy another bottle I think it would be a good dram to introduce my freinds to who are interested in exploring my expensive habit. 😆
It's a very smooth pour, super enjoyable!
[Whisky Live Paris 2015] Sampled with other Jameson products available.  They all sorta taste the same...
Very smooth and easy to drink

Nose is light, toasted grain and faint honey. Smooth malt on the palate, some sweetness and a hint of orchard fruits and slight creaminess. Some bitterness lingers. Probably will need to revisit, as the flavor profile seems light. 8/18/17

Hints of banana, clove, and vanilla on the nose. Sip starts very smooth but light, almost a banana custard before providing notes of clove and very faint undertones of something bright - lemon zest or sumac. Finishes almost smoother than it started. While I don't get a lot of flavor variety out of the 18 year, I appreciate it's relaxed nature sometimes.
The best Irish whiskey I've ever had the pleasure of tasting.

I had this along with Jameson and their Barrel Select side by side by side and this really stands out above those.  It still has the "bitter" Jameson finish, however, I found it less "harsh."  I would defiantly drink this again neat, with a rock, or a splash.
crisp and light with buttery toffee flavors that linger
Lights up the palate in all the right ways. Cannot reccomend enough if getting into Irish Whisky and want to make this your first "trophy" bottle or dram. 4.25/5
Needed a bit of ice but very good. Smooth earthy taste, a little sweet.

N: kókusz és vanília, édes
P: olajos, kesernyés
8
Very similar to regular Jameson, just more well rounded. Doesn’t have that metallic flavor. More defined flavors of vanilla, biscuit and honey.
Sweet, chocolate ice cream. Reminds me of the Nikka Coffey Malt.
Caramel type scents with a hint of vanilla and spice to start, play barrel tastes in the middle, and a smooth, light, and sweet finish.
3.5 as Jameson would be a 3. A bit smoother than regular Jameson but not much different in flavor profile.
2nd bottle.  A flagship for the Irish.  🍯 sweet on the nose.  Oily spice takes over on the palate.  Finish is long...bitter at first but not harsh then smooth.

Whiskey extravaganza #3

This is good - it’s more interesting than standard Jameson but even an 18 year old whiskey can only be so good when it’s been neutered down to 40%. I’ll save my money and grab a Redbreast 12CS or Tyrconnell  16 instead.

Very, very smooth. Like everyone says. It comes and goes pretty quickly actually. Very strong Carmel and vanilla. Nutty finish. 
Added water: Even stronger nutty. Brings out some smoke!! After-taste is different, can’t put my finger on it.
Hard to beat!  Very smooth and creamy
A good whiskey but kinda boring.  clean easy sipper.

Lots o honey!  Really thick and coats the glass.  Absolutely no alcohol burn at all - very smooth and rich.  Fruity, honey vanilla blast.... finish is short but forces you to drink it quicker and get another! Really enjoyable....
Delicious and sweet.  Very fine Irish whiskey.  Lots of fruit notes and a little bit of brown sugar.
Definately the best Jameson has produced
Holy shit. It’s so fucking good! It was the sweet familiarity of Jameson but crafted into perfection. Definitely a personal favorite of mine
Sweet honey and wild flowers on the nose. Honey and maple that give way to a spicy note and a thing of iodine.
Smoothest whisky so far. I love it
Wonderful. Is so sublime that I cannot tell how amazing it is. I love peated Whiskies but this one has almost none, but is incredibly smooth.

Frankly sometimes i think Jameson bottles fall from the sky for me to taste them. Tonight i was invited a dram of this baby, the house owner was hyped about it and it really is a good whisky. Very similar to a Macallan 18yo.

Bottled at 40%abv, burnished gold color.

On the nose, creamy. Vanilla ice cream, cinnamon stink, caramel. Lovely.

On the palate, creme brulee, brown sugar and clove. Finish medium, liquorice and spices. 

Overall it didn't change my life but it is a good dram. 88 over 100 my score for it.
Best Whiskey I have every had............so far.   Very Smooth
